stanza.line: Alack what poverty my muse brings forthforth
That having such a scope to show her pridepride

Than when it hath my added praise besidebeside
O blame me not if I no more can writewrite
Look in your glass and there appears a faceface
That over-goes my blunt invention quitequite
Dulling my lines and doing me disgracedisgrace
Were it not sinful then striving to mendmend
To mar the subject that before was wellwell
For to no other pass my verses tendtend
Than of your graces and your gifts to telltell
